docs.snippet: The United States transport Oriental, Captain TUZO, arrived at this port at 10 o'clock last night, from Key West and Port Royal. She left the former port on the 4th inst., at 4 P.M., and arrived off Port Royal at 4 P.M. of the 6th; was detained...

headline.main: FROM KEY WEST AND PORT ROYAL.; Arrival of the Oriental Confirmation of the Capture of Brunswick and Fernandina Vessels Lying at Key West and Port Royal.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States transport Oriental, Captain TUZO, arrived at this port at 10 o'clock last night, from Key West and Port Royal. She left the former port on the 4th inst., at 4 P.M., and arrived off Port Royal at 4 P.M. of the 6th; was detained outside 20 hours for want of a pilot. She left Port Royal at 5 P.M. of the 8th, and experienced fine weather the entire passage.

docs.snippet: United States steam transport Philadelphia HENRY BARTON Commander, from Fort Pickens March 1, Fort Jefferson, Tortugas, March 4, and Key West March 6th, 8 A.M., arrived last night. The Philadelphia took out from New York 116 head of cattle and 50...

headline.main: An Arrival from Fort Pickens.; PASSENGERS.

docs.lead_paragraph: United States steam transport Philadelphia HENRY BARTON Commander, from Fort Pickens March 1, Fort Jefferson, Tortugas, March 4, and Key West March 6th, 8 A.M., arrived last night. The Philadelphia took out from New York 116 head of cattle and 50 sheep, and landed them all without losing one.

docs.snippet: The Assembly met at 7 o'clock. A number of petitions being presented to allow the Supervisors of Madison County to grant licenses, a struggle took place in reference thereto, the prohibitory men desiring they should be referred to the Select...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Assembly met at 7 o'clock. A number of petitions being presented to allow the Supervisors of Madison County to grant licenses, a struggle took place in reference thereto, the prohibitory men desiring they should be referred to the Select Committee on Excise. The petitions, after a long debate, were referred to the Committee of the Whole.

headline.main: WASHINGTON'S BIRTHDAY ABROAD.; INTERESTING CELEBRATION IN LONDON. SPEECHES OF THE AMERICAN MINISTERS, BISHOP MCILVAINE, HON. FREEMAN MORSE, CYRUS W. FIELD, &C., &C.

docs.snippet: Union forces under Gen. Curtis reported victorious at Pea Ridge, Ark

headline.main: ANOTHER GREAT BATTLE.; A Most Glorious Victory in Arkansas. The Combined Rebel Army Under Price, McCulloch, Van Dorn, and McIntosh, Defeated. A Desperate Battle, Lasting Three Days. FINAL ROUT OF THE ENEMY. OUR CAVALRY IN FULL PURSUIT. Capture of Guns, Flags, Provisions, &c., in Large Quantities. Our Loss in Killed and Wounded One Thousand. THAT OF THE ENEMY STILL LARGER.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following letter explains the position of Gen. J.H. LANE: LEAVENWORTH, Kansas, Feb, 26, 1862. SIR: There should be a perfect understanding between you, the local Representatives of the people of Kansas, and your Representatives in the National Congress. To this end, I make the following state- ment:

docs.snippet: It is proposed to introduce into our public schools, as a part of the system of education, a course of physical training consisting principally of military drill.

headline.main: MILITARY EDUCATION.; The Propriety of Introducing Military Drill and Physical Training into our Public Schools European Authorities.

docs.abstract: Propriety of introducing military drill and physical training into public schools discussed
docs.lead_paragraph: It is proposed to introduce into our public schools, as a part of the system of education, a course of physical training consisting principally of military drill.

docs.snippet: The House, last night, devoted the whole session to the discussion of the details of the Annual Appropriation bill, and did not then complete the bill. The appropriation for books for the State Library was cut down from $4,000 to $2,000, and, on...

headline.main: AFFAIRS AT THE STATE CAPITAL.; OUR ALBANY CORRESPONDENCE. The Annual Appropriation Bill The Committee upon Cities City Railroads The Bill for the Public Defence Important Debate Speech by Mr. Raymond.

docs.lead_paragraph: The House, last night, devoted the whole session to the discussion of the details of the Annual Appropriation bill, and did not then complete the bill. The appropriation for books for the State Library was cut down from $4,000 to $2,000, and, on motion of Mr. STETSON, backed by Mr. PHELPS, of your City, the appropriation to the Agricultural Societies was raised to $10,000 from $8,000, as reported.

docs.snippet: The bill to prevent trade on Sunday was favorably reported.

headline.main: PROCEEDINGS OF THE LEGISLATURE.; SENATE. Important Bills in the Assembly. Bills in the Senate.

docs.lead_paragraph: The bill to prevent trade on Sunday was favorably reported.
